DataElement.preferredDefinition: A malignant, usually aggressive tumor composed of atypical, neoplastic melanocytes.  Most often, melanomas arise in the skin (cutaneous melanomas) and include the following histologic subtypes: superficial spreading melanoma, nodular melanoma, acral lentiginous melanoma, and lentigo maligna melanoma.  Cutaneous melanomas may arise from acquired or congenital melanocytic or dysplastic nevi.  Melanomas may also arise in other anatomic sites including the gastrointestinal system, eye, urinary tract, and reproductive system.  Melanomas frequently metastasize to lymph nodes, liver, lungs, and brain.:The medical science, and specialty practice, concerned with all aspects of disease, but with special reference to the essential nature, causes, and development of abnormal conditions, as well as the structural and functional changes that result from the disease processes. Informally used to mean the result of such an examination._The percentage of cells in a sample currently undergoing mitosis._Measure for the proliferation status of a cell population

Most often, melanomas arise in the skin (cutaneous melanomas) and include the following histologic subtypes: superficial spreading melanoma, nodular melanoma, acral lentiginous melanoma, and lentigo maligna melanoma.  Cutaneous melanomas may arise from acquired or congenital melanocytic or dysplastic nevi. Melanomas frequently metastasize to lymph nodes, liver, lungs, and brain.:The medical science, and specialty practice, concerned with all aspects of disease, but with special reference to the essential nature, causes, and development of abnormal conditions, as well as the structural and functional changes that result from the disease processes. Concepts.definition: A malignant, usually aggressive tumor composed of atypical, neoplastic melanocytes. Most often, melanomas arise in the skin (cutaneous melanomas) and include the following histologic subtypes: superficial spreading melanoma, nodular melanoma, acral lentiginous melanoma, and lentigo maligna melanoma. Cutaneous melanomas may arise from acquired or congenital melanocytic or dysplastic nevi. Melanomas may also arise in other anatomic sites including the gastrointestinal system, eye, urinary tract, and reproductive system. Melanomas frequently metastasize to lymph nodes, liver, lungs, and brain.

The medical science, and specialty practice, concerned with all aspects of disease, but with special reference to the essential nature, causes, and development of abnormal conditions, as well as the structural and functional changes that result from the disease processes. Informally used to mean the result of such an examination.

Property.preferredDefinition: The percentage of cells in a sample currently undergoing mitosis.

Concepts.definition: The percentage of cells in a sample currently undergoing mitosis.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Measure for the proliferation status of a cell population

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Per Square Millimeter Less Than One Mitotic Figure

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Per Square Millimeter Less Than One Mitotic Figure
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The microscopic appearance of a cell undergoing mitosis.:The smallest natural number and quantity it denotes: a single entity, unit, or object.:A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest is smaller than another object in quantity or measure or value or status.:A unit of area measurement equal to a square measuring one millimeter on each side. One square millimeter is equal to 10(E-2) square centimeter and 10(E-6) square meter.:For each, generally denoting a ratio.

Concepts.definition: For each, generally denoting a ratio.
A unit of area measurement equal to a square measuring one millimeter on each side. One square millimeter is equal to 10(E-2) square centimeter and 10(E-6) square meter.
A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest is smaller than another object in quantity or measure or value or status.
The smallest natural number and quantity it denotes: a single entity, unit, or object.
The microscopic appearance of a cell undergoing mitosis.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not stated explicitly or in detail.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Per Square Millimeter Greater Than or Equal To One Mitotic Figure

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Per Square Millimeter Greater Than or Equal To One Mitotic Figure
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The microscopic appearance of a cell undergoing mitosis.:The smallest natural number and quantity it denotes: a single entity, unit, or object.:A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest exceeds the other object in one of these ways.:A unit of area measurement equal to a square measuring one millimeter on each side. One square millimeter is equal to 10(E-2) square centimeter and 10(E-6) square meter.:For each, generally denoting a ratio.

Concepts.definition: For each, generally denoting a ratio.
A unit of area measurement equal to a square measuring one millimeter on each side. One square millimeter is equal to 10(E-2) square centimeter and 10(E-6) square meter.

A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest exceeds the other object in one of these ways.
The smallest natural number and quantity it denotes: a single entity, unit, or object.
The microscopic appearance of a cell undergoing mitosis.
